page.title: 13The ecology of Cowlinge
page.content: This area is mainly open farland, consisting of large fields separated by unmanaged hedgerows.There are a few copses which are used for pheasant rearing, and during the winter months some organised 'shoots' take place. The river Kennet rises at Hobbles Green and runs fed by drainage ditches through Cowlinge. Although this is possibly polluted by chemicals washed from the fields it contains frogs, toads and newts. The river Sioh runs through Little Bradley and contains trout etc. Most footpaths in the area are disused, only a few including a bridle path between Cowlinge and Lt. Bradley are used regularly.A cold wet spring followed a sever winter with hard frosts and snowfall,a cool wet summer has caused much vegetation and new life.
